reviewText:
Early Access Review

Nothing I enjoy more than having a nice relaxing evening playing a mindless twin stick shooter, plowing through waves of creatures, and building up that old school high score..  (brought back memories of my days plugging quarters into the arcade, trying to beat some over the top high score.)  When I first saw Critical Annihilation my first thought was this looks awesome..  After playing the game for a few hours I said yes, this game is awesome.  Voxel based games have really taken off the last few years...  While some may take issue with the art style and game play, I love it.

Gameplay -

Typical twin stick shooter game play, (pretty sure they are still considered twin stick on the PC, anyway) the environment is billed as being totally destructible, which is great, but on almost all the levels you'll be too busy avoiding bullets, zombies, spiders and everything else the game throws at you... In all that mayhem, you'll likely forget all about the Environment being destructible.   From what I saw stuff got destroyed after a while, but this isn't a game about causing massive destruction, but about killing lots of enemies.  What sets Critical Annihilation apart from the other twin stickers out there....  along with the above-mentioned environment destruction, the game has some rpg elements as well, with various stats you can increase as you level up.  The game appears to have 3 classes which are unique from each other, Soldier, Engineer and Scout, each class has their own advantages and disadvantages..  The Soldier has the best base combat stats, but no regen or shields..   The Engineer has ok combat stats but starts with a high shield, the Scout has the weakest combat stats but starts off with high regen.

The stages are fairly large (they are contained to a large round play space), nice amount of room to kite them around (kiting is the act of running around in large circles while the enemies lump together allowing you to pick them off one by one) very common tactic in twin shooters.  Although you can employ the kiting tactic to get an advantage, it starts being far less effective the higher in levels you get.  The last stage I played had I could have sworn 50 - 60 enemies on it.  The difficult really ramps up, with each stage you finish.

CA has 2 main game modes, Campaign, and Survival..   Campaign's and the survival modes are the same, with the major difference being, the campaign will eventually have you wiping out the enemies and facing a boss battle prior to moving onto the next area.   While survival is as you may have guessed trying to stay alive for as long as humanly possible... (After about 3 minutes or so survival seems to get very very hairy, and dare I say very fun.).  A third game mode is grayed out, being an early access title I'll make the leap this mode is currently being worked on, or I didn't finish the game far enough along to unlock it.

pro's
Fun and addictive game play
Decent music,
very challenging,
high intensity

con's
some minor glitches with enemies
occasional hit detection failures

[Summation]
I'd recommend this fun title, have yourself some mindless fun, slaying all manners of creatures, level up your characters, chew bubblegum and kick butts.  Just remember when you fail (which you will) dust yourself off and try again.  Just remember, winners never quit!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Critical Annihilation is an isometric twin-stick shooter with a voxel graphic style. Not only the graphics are made out of voxels, but the game itself is based upon a voxel engine, thus allowing for destructible environments and some pretty good looking particle and lighting effects when there is an explosion. It is also worth noting that the can be somewhat demanding on your computer, especially during big explosions due to all the particles flying and the big craters that appear on the ground. That said, the game already has a very detailed options menu so if you run into trouble running the game, you can do some tweaking and it will most likely run fine.

One thing I must say is that I’m not really one to play much of these top down survival shooters. Still, I was atracted by its rather unique look and was surprised that I found myself enjoying the gameplay as much as I did.

One other thing that surprised me was the soundtrack. I’m not much of a listener to this type of electronic music (dubstep?) but I must say that after playing the game for a few hours, it started feeling quite catchy and it kind of grew on me.

The core:By looking at the game trailer and screenshots you can clearly guess what the game is all about, mowing down hordes of enemies. That said, I’m going to try to explain some other mechanics that the game has.

First and foremost, you have three different modes, one of which is not available at the moment. You have your campaign mode, that currently has 15 different missions, which allows you to unlock powerups, perks, weapons and the specific mission maps for survival mode. Survival mode, as you probably imagined, is just survive as long as you can. Last but by no means least, “classic survival” mode, which is unavailable at the moment, is basically survival mode but with no powerups and you select your weapon at the beginning, atleast according to its description. As with any other game of this genre, Critical Annihilation also features online highscore leaderboards.

Now, where the game gets interesting, atleast for me, is with the ability to choose different characters and improve them, unlock perks and different abilities. As of right now, you can choose between three different classes, Soldier, Engineer and Scout. Each one of them has their own ups and downs and you should try each one of them out and see which one better suits your playstyle. That said, the character progression is fast paced, every now and then you’ll be able to spend points to upgrade your stats (Life, Accuracy, Speed, Stamina, Regeneration and Shield). You’ll also be able to choose different perks and abilities for your current character.

Perks are basically passive abilities, such as increased life regeneration and the ability to make enemy bullets move slower. Abilities on the other hand are divided into two categories, offensive and defensive abilities. While playing you can activate your offensive ability with “Q” and your defensive ability with “E”. Examples of offensive abilities are things such as a sentry turret or an airstrike, while defensive abilties can be something like a plasma shield that makes you invulnerable for a short period of time or the ability to slow down time.

After killing them, some enemies will drop either weapons or powerups. Weapons range from your standard assault rifle, shotgun, laser pulse rifle, grenade launcher and minigun. The minigun particularly is really satisfying to use, since it completely obliterates waves of enemies. Powerups can be simple things such as medkits or life saving items such as nukes, turrets and rocket launchers. The nukes are my favourite because they cause a huge explosion and leave a hole on the ground.

One thing I also found out to be really helpful was the ability to jump, which is rather unusal for a game like this. Jumping allows you to shoot rockets above the enemies at the front so that the explosion hits the middle of a crowd, thus causing more casualties.


Verdict:
To sum things up, I do have some minor things that I think need to be adressed. One is the fact that the game has no story whatsoever. This is not necessarily a bad thing for some people, especially people who are die hard fans of this genre, but others like myself might find this to be a negative point.

One other very slight complaint that I have is the fact that the the sprinting animation is very hard to distinguish from the standard move animation. I believe that having a different animation for sprinting would allow new players to distinguish the two a little bit better. Maybe I’m just nitpicking.

Still, after looking at the forums, I can say that the developer is open and takes into consideration the ideas and suggestions given by the players and the community, so it wouldn’t surprise me if these small issues I have with the game would be adressed.

In the end, the game is pretty simple, and people looking for an in-depth shooter might not find that here. That said, this game is ideal for people who just want to have some mindless fun and have the satisfaction of shooting endless hordes of enemies in the face and, as I mentioned, the game has its fair share of perks, weapons and power ups, so if you’re into that sort of thing, I think you’ll find plenty of enjoyment here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very beautiful grafik and physiks, its challenging and has great music. I highly recommend it.

However there are some suggestions and tips how this game could get better. (Since its still early access and I just had some ideas, maybe theyre stupid, but hey you can just ignore them.)

Ideas:

1. I haven't completed the campain yet but I already wish there would be more levels. Maybe some more stages and/or Bosslevels after a Chapter.

2. More characters. I dont now if you have to unlock some first but it would be cool if there were more options depending how you think you could survive best.

3. A co - op mode would be very nice. Dont now if local is needed, but online has to be a thing.

Bugs?:

1. Dont know if that is intented but some monsters just clip through the environment. And I checked, no, the obstacles were completly intact.

2. When an enemie ( for example a dog) stands right infront of me, the bullets spawn behind him and do no damage, which is annoying when you are not fast enough to back off.

3. Balance: The diffuculty is nice and balanced. The only thing bothering me are the special enemies with special guns, which make so much damage if you dont look out. Most of them are big enought to see, but some look very similar to the normal" guys and get overlooked so easy. And the red bar doesnt realy help. Maybe make the similar looking ones just bigger or shinier? Would be very helpfull. EDIT: As some other reviewers say
date: I also think the cross to aim should be better to see.\n\nPS: I dont speak english

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This video features a non-biased quick look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=khekEyS6VR8

Do you like Twin-sticks? Do you like lots of gore and particle explosions? Look no further. Critical Annihilation is a Twin-Stick SHMUP (Shoot-em Up) made entirely out of tiny voxels. We take advantage of voxel technology to hype up the explosive gameplay. Everything is destructible to its core. As your home planet gets invaded by aliens you decide to take up arms with the rest of the planet and annihilate every single alien in site. As you progress in the game you'll bring yourself to whole new planets like the Moon and Mars until you've reached the aliens Mothership. Why exactly are these cliche aliens attacking your cliche planet in the good old fashion cliche way? It's for you to find out as you destroy every cube of their being. This is the same game played by popular youtubers Markiplier and JackSepticEye; Critical Mass. Now with updated art and updated code to bring you a more full, and action packed experience. - highly Recommended!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far, with only less than an hour of play, I can tell this game is EXACTLY what I'd hoped it'd be. A fast paced game, custimization of your character, and most of all, pretty much everything blows up exactly as I hoped it would.
The only thing I noticed while playing it is that sometimes your cursor gets a bit lost in the more intense moments as mobs of aliens and cyborgs surround you.
If they could add anything in, I'd love it if they had a feature to make the aiming cursor more visible, either by adding some kind of glow to it as it passes over an enemy, or maybe a button that can be assigned that makes it pop out with some kind of radar like effect to make if obvious that hey, on top of all the ♥♥♥ you're kicking, here's your mouse!
Outside of that, this game is easily one of my favorites I've played, ever.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you have played the original version of the game on GameJolt, you know exactly what to expect: Great soundtrack, destructive world, hoards of enemies, and explosions that can be described in no other way than simply satisfying. Critical Annihilation only adds to the fun with more enemies, more destruction and more soon to come. I was skepticle to buy this game at first considering some other early access games I purchased were not as fun as I'd hoped, but this is an excelent acception.

Pros:
The world is very destructable
Physics are nice
Powerups are amazing, esspecially the slow motion and explosion.
This game is definetly challenging
Great soundtrack
fair veriety of maps
Again, the explosions can only be described as satisfying.

Cons:
The game gets difficult extremley fast, I mean level 4 fast. I like a good challenge in games but this is rediculous with now way to change the difficulty.
Yeah thats pritty much it...

Conclusion:
Defenitly would recommend this game, even in early access.

What I would like to see added:
Multiplayer of coarse, it would be amazing to play survival co-op with friends online.
Would be great if players who make maps could change the entire layout of the map so instead of just a circle, they could make an adventure map. Again, that would be great in multiplayer.
Adventure game mode would be nice but if it is user made and posted on community, thats fine too.

Although some would argue it is not currently worth £7, I disagree. I have spoken to the developers and have seen their commitment in the forums. They are building more content and releasing patches quickly. If the devs act on their promises, within a few months I know that those who feel as though there was not enough content will have changed their minds.

If you’re looking for a fun shootemup with a retro feel and awesome soundtrack, this game is totally for you!

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Disclaimer - I have been gifted a free key for this game for review purposes, however my review will be kept as truthful as possible, since I am meant to help developers and buyers/gamers.

Critical Annihilation review

Overview
Critical Annihilation is a Twin-Stick Shoot-em Up voxel game in which almost every pixel can be blown up in a sense, Published and Developed, into early access Feb 12, 2016 by Devoga.

Graphics
For a pixel game not only does it have decent graphics, they have also been optimised so everyone no matter the pc can run them, they will no doubt be improved in the future with no cost of player loosing fps.

Music/Options/Menu
The music was fantastic, the options, simple to the point easy to navigate and understand, the menu was fancy looking and great for an early access game.

Pros and Cons
Pros:
Potential Potential Potential!!!
Fun time waster
A great survival game in the future if the devs do it right
Great physics

Cons:
No story for the events taking place
No backstory for the character's
No knowledge of what type of aliens you are fighting, and their motives

A good game with a large fanbase as well as future, I give it a 8.0/10

I have been gifted the key by the kind developers of the game. They make my review about games like this possible.
If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group:    The Group
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Basic InformationTitle: Critical Annihilation
Genre: Action, Indie, Early Access
Developer: Devoga
Publisher: Devoga
Release Date: 12 Feb, 2016

Basic OverviewCritical Annihilation is a Shoot 'Em Up game, which focuses mainly on killing enemies and destorying the environment around you. The game itself is really well presented and polished up for the current state that it's in (Early Access), the art style of the game is really niceand the current amount of weapons is decent for the time being. It's very addicting to play and is insanely fun. It is worth noting that this game does demand for your computer to be decent, especially when it comes to destorying the enviroment with all of the explosions happening and big craters that are on the ground. If you are having troubles with performance issues of this game, then I suggest you do some changes in the opitions menu to make the game run smoothly.

GameplayCritical Annihilation is a fast paced shoot 'em up with some really cool perks, and character progression. The game is strangely addiciting along with all of the enemies that you have to kill. The destructable enviroment of the game really fits well with all of the enemies that will be running at you trying to kill you. Although, when playing through the game, it seems that the game is really demanding for your computer to be decent. With all of the explosions happening when you pla through the game and craters that appear on the ground, make sure your specs of your computer are good enough to run this game decently. There is a rather large selection of weapons available up for use to kill your enemies with. Providing that there is also randomly generated drop system in this current stage of the game, it is really impressive to see that sort of detail be in the game already at this stage of the game that is currently in Early Access.

Art StyleThe decent visuals and art style of this game really fit the type of game the developers made for this game. Most of the stages are very well detailed, with vibrant lighting and colours which really bring this game to life. The games graphics are made out of voxels, but upon doing some research of this game, it was also based upon the voxel engine which allows for the destructable enviroments that happen during the game. The lighting really comes into play when explosions happen throughout, the lighting is really well presented when exlpsions occur and that's when the lighting effect is best shown off.

Music & SoundGenerically, the sounds are very nicely done and presented when playing through the game. With the music in the background that really fits the fast paced shooter game, with a kind of dubstep music to it. The sounds of the guns and the enemies are fairly nice, not annoying like some game where they use the same sound effects for each gun.

ConclusionA very fun and addictive game to play, with some really nice graphics and explosions that occur through the game. Although it demands a bit on your PC, so make sure that your specs or up with the recommened specs. If you are having trouble then tweek some settings to make the game run smooth. Some really nice music to fit the fast paced type of game.

For more reviews on a wide range of games, go and follow Good Games Giveaways & Reviews curator group here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a pretty cool game, the way that the physics work is one of a kind. I recommend this game because the devs are active and updating, this is a pretty good sign for games like these.

Anyways, I guess I should go over gameplay mechanics.

Gameplay Pros:

It's very chaotic, the amount of chaos is pretty amazing.
It has a lot of weapons, awesome that this engine can build weapons well.
It has a varity of enemies
It has a pretty good bullet hell dodging system
And it has some good design all around.

Gameplay cons:
No multiplayer (Coming soon hopefully)
No screen Rotation
And some abilities are missing.

I can imagine this could turn out to be a pretty enjoyable arcade type game. As a personal hope from me, please keep it up devs. Don't be like 75% of the early access games on steam.

Hope my Review helped you out!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is up there with my favorite. I can't think of a better way to describe it than in a pro's and con's list, So i'll keep it short and simple.


Pros
- Absolutly beautiful graphics, There is something about voxel based graphics that makes me fall in love with a game.

- Everything is destructable, With everything bieng made of small bricks, it creates a great enviornment for blowing things up and shooting every thing. There is nothing more satisfying than finishing a level and seeing the large craters in the ground accompanied with half a building.

- Plenty of stuff to do, There are tons of levels to play, plenty of weapons to fight with, and plenty of enemies to fight, giving you enough explosions to last a lifetime.

- Very customizable, When you enter the options menu, there is a large assortment of settings to change, for graphics, audio, and key bindings. If you don't have the best computer, you can still play this game with sustainable FPS.

- BOOM BANG POW BUZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ BOOM EXPLOSIONS


Cons

-Needs a little balancing on certain levels

- Nope can't think of anthing else

- BOOM EXPLOSIONS
